p: Ascorbate is also important for adaptive immune responses, starting with the observations that reducing environments make immune responses more efficient ( 140); it increases the levels of IFN produced by activated fibroblasts ( 141); improves neutrophil function by preserving/restoring function of their myeloperoxidase; is essential for lymphocyte development, stimulating the proliferation of NK cells ( 142); and has ample epigenetic effects through dioxygenases TET (ten-eleven translocases) and Jumonji C (JmjC)-domain-containing histone demethylases ( 131).
